Class RoomManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • RoomManager
  • public class RoomManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to create all the rooms at the beginning of the game, add items to them, and store them.
    Version:
    29/11/2020
    Author:
    Alexandru Matei

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoomManager

        public RoomManager()

    • Method Detail

      • createRooms

        public void createRooms()
        Creates the rooms/locations for the game and stores them. Each room is associated to a name, which will be later used to get the reference to that room. This is where the whole "game map" is created and laid out.

      • addItemsToRooms

        public void addItemsToRooms()
        Creates and adds all the items in the game to their respective rooms.

      • getRoomByName

        public Room getRoomByName​(java.lang.String name)
        Get the reference to a room object by providing its associated name.
        Parameters:
        name - Implementation-level name of the room ("livingroom", etc.)
        Returns:
        Room object associated with the provided name.

      • getCurrentRoom

        public Room getCurrentRoom()
        Get the reference to the room the player is in.
        Returns:
        Room object where the player is.

      • setCurrentRoom

        public void setCurrentRoom​(Room nextRoom)
        Change the room the player is in to a specified room.
        Parameters:
        nextRoom - A room object - the room you want to move the player to.

      • goBack

        public boolean goBack()
        Takes the player back to the last room they were in.
        Returns:
        true if the player has been in any room beforehand, false if the game just started.
